Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Realm \Realm\ (r[e^]lm), n. [OE. realme, ream, reaume, OF. reialme, roialme, F. royaume, fr. (assumed) LL. regalimen, from L. regalis royal. See {Regal}.] 1. A royal jurisdiction or domain; a region which is under the dominion of a king; a kingdom. [1913 Webster]
The absolute master of realms on which the sun perpetually shone. --Motley. [1913 Webster]
2. Hence, in general, province; region; country; domain; department; division; as, the realm of fancy. [1913 Webster]

realm n 1: a domain in which something is dominant; "the untroubled kingdom of reason"; "a land of make-believe"; "the rise of the realm of cotton in the south" [syn: {kingdom}, {land}] 2: a knowledge domain that you are interested in or are communicating about; "it was a limited domain of discourse"; "here we enter the region of opinion"; "the realm of the occult" [syn: {domain}, {region}] 3: the domain ruled by a king or queen [syn: {kingdom}]
